resources.string: Thanks for installing NeverBeLate!

Congratulations on the first step toward taking control of your schedule and eliminating lateness in your professional and personal life.

This quick tour is simple to use: swipe left and right to move between pages, and swipe up and down to scroll.

Now swipe to the next page to get started!
… or skip the tour.
Enabling NeverBeLate

Turning on the NeverBeLate Advance Warning system is simple. On the main screen you will find a checkbox just the like the one below. Just check the box, and then rest easy knowing that NeverBeLate is working behind the scenes to keep you on time to all of your events.
Well, there is actually one more thing that NeverBeLate needs to work properly. Swipe to the next page to learn what it is!
An Event with a Searchable Address

To add an event for NeverBeLate to warn you about, first go to your favorite calendar app. It may be labeled just \"Calendar\" in your app drawer. Then create a new event for your next appointment. In the \"Where\" or \"Location\" field of the new event, enter a searchable address.\n\nThe simplest definition for a searchable address is one that you can search for in Google Maps. When you create a new event in your favorite calendar app, NeverBeLate needs the event location to be a searchable address so that it can determine travel distances and times correctly. Good examples are \"221b Baker Street, London, UK\", or if you\'re in a hurry, just \"Atlanta, GA\" or even \"77059\". A good tradeoff between accuracy and speed of entry is to enter just the street address and the postal code, as shown in the example below.
Where
30 Rockefeller, 10112

When you save the event, you are done! NeverBeLate will find your event automatically, and use the location that you entered to help it decide when you should leave to arrive on time. If you leave the location field of an event empty, NeverBeLate will simply ignore it. Looks pretty easy, doesn\'t it?
Marked Events

\"But what if I want to use both general locations and searchable addresses in my calendar?\" Now you can! A new marked events feature has been added to help tell NeverBeLate which events you want it to find. Enabling marked events is simple: look in the Settings menu to find the \"Only marked events\" option shown below, and check the box.

Then start placing an asterisk or star (*) at the beginning of your searchable event locations, just like this: \"*Atlanta, GA\". NeverBeLate will then only look for the marked events, and will ignore the rest. Next time a coworker invites you to a meeting in \"Joe\'s office\" (not a searchable address), NeverBeLate won\'t incorrectly warn you that \"Joe\'s office\" is 895 minutes away!
Check the Traffic

One of the most powerful features of NeverBeLate is the instant opportunity to check the traffic between where you are now and where you need to be. When an Advance Warning dialog pops up to warn you that it is time to leave for your next event, you will see a large green button just like the one below.

Press this button to view a colorful map showing the traffic in the area. Your current location will be marked with a blue flag, and your event location will be marked with a red flag. The traffic will be color-coded just like in Google Maps. If the traffic is red, be sure to leave as soon as possible!
Just the Beginning

These few steps cover just the basics of putting NeverBeLate to work for you. Explore the settings menu to discover new ways to adjust the performance of NeverBeLate to fit your lifestyle and travel needs. You can adjust the travel method, the early arrival time, and your preferred notification method, just to name a few.

A good productivity app should help you get more done with less effort. NeverBeLate is designed to be an indispensable tool that blends with your favorite calendar app and makes sticking to your schedule an effortless task. Test it for yourself: go create a test event in your calendar, and let NeverBeLate take care of the reminder!
